articles.title: Scientists discover strong, unexpected link between Earth's magnetic field and oxygen levels
articles.description: Earth's magnetic field and oxygen levels have increased more or less in parallel over the past 540 million years, suggesting the two factors are linked in some way, researchers say.
articles.content:
Researchers found a strong correlation between oxygen levels and the geomagnetic field, but it's unclear if one influences the other.
Earth's magnetic field and oxygen levels are inextricably linked, new research suggests.
